body.sentence: 50 mL of 1 mM AgNO3 aqueous solution is heated at 200 °C to boilling.
1 mL of 0.1 M trisodium citrate solution is fast added into the solution
The mixture is kept boiling for 16 min under constant stirring at 500 rpm, then allowed to cool down to room temperature.
The resultant colloidal mixture is of yellow-gray color. Excess reducing agent is removed by washing the AgNP colloid three times with Milli-Q ultrapure water.
1 mL silica bead stock (5.0% w/v) is dried overnight at 60 °C and dispersed in 1 mL anhydrous ethanol.
1 mL ethanol solution containing 0.2% APTES is mixed with above silica beads ethanol suspension and allowed to react for 24 h at room temperature under continuous stirring at 200 rpm
After reacting for 24 h, the solution is purifi ed by centrifuging three times at 1500 RCF for 10min using anhydrous ethanol and discarding the supernatant.
The remaining pellet is further dried slowly at 60 °C before dispersing in 4 mL distilled water.

AgNP coated silica beads are prepared in 1 mL by continuous agitation of AgNP colloids and adding APTES modifi ed silica beads in a volume ratio of 997:3. This process is performed at room temperature under agitation at 100 rpm.
